gibbs_387_336.original_moral: The master has better insight than anyone else when it comes to his own business.

abstemius_52.alt_moral: Only untrustworthy people blame the consequences of their own actions on others.
abstemius_52.original_moral: We should not expect that our crimes will always go unpunished.

abstemius_53.alt_moral: It is very unwise, even for the greatest of men, to provoke the least, as they may find a way to enact revenge.
abstemius_53.original_moral: It is better by far to be governed by one chief, than by many.

abstemius_54.alt_moral: No one gladly revisits a place where they got hurt.
abstemius_54.original_moral: No one is so loving of a friend that they would not prefer their own good to that of another.

abstemius_55.alt_moral: It is dangerous to believe a story, and dangerous not to believe it.
abstemius_55.original_moral: Not all things are suitable for all people.

abstemius_57.alt_moral: Do not play the wise man after the fact.
abstemius_57.original_moral: Even beneficial things all appear to be drastic and sure to hurt for those those who are unfamiliar with them and inexperienced.

abstemius_58.alt_moral: When people won't listen to reason through kind means, they must be made to understand through harsh ones.
abstemius_58.original_moral: Many pretend to be concerned about some people's demise, when however what they want is for it to come quickly.

abstemius_61.alt_moral: There is nothing more valuable than liberty.
abstemius_61.original_moral: Every Season has its own work.

abstemius_62.alt_moral: Relying too much on subordinates can lead to unintended consequences.
abstemius_62.original_moral: People are to be judged by their actions, not by their appearance.

abstemius_64.alt_moral: Even the strongest can be brought low by unchecked desires.
abstemius_64.original_moral: No one can be safe in peace unless they are always ready to face an enemy in case of war.

abstemius_65.original_moral: Save a Thief from the Gallows, and he'll cut your Throat.

abstemius_66.original_moral: Unwanted visits are a nuisance to a peaceful person's life.

abstemius_68.original_moral: Possession is nine-tenths of the law.

abstemius_69.alt_moral: A false friend is the worst kind of enemy.

abstemius_70.original_moral: Many people give up their vices not out of a love for virtue, but because they can no longer continue indulging in them.

abstemius_71.alt_moral: Act as you profess to believe.
abstemius_71.original_moral: Better to be alone than in bad company.

abstemius_72.original_moral: People should not be judged by their appearances, but by their actions.

abstemius_73.alt_moral: It's good to be able to laugh at yourself.

abstemius_74.original_moral: An enemy in disguise is much more unforgivable than an open enemy.

abstemius_75.alt_moral: He that has many friends, has no friends.
abstemius_75.original_moral: We should not pick fights with people stronger than we are.

abstemius_76.alt_moral: Not all things are suitable for all people.
abstemius_76.original_moral: Men who are wickedly inclined will not stop their vicious behavior, no matter who urges them to do so.
